intro: Patagonium griseum, commonly known as the Patagonian stonecrop, is a succulent plant native to the arid regions of South America. It belongs to the family Crassulaceae and is characterized by its thick, fleshy leaves that store water, allowing it to survive in dry conditions. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils, often forming dense mats or low-growing clusters. Its small, star-shaped flowers are usually white or pale pink, appearing in late spring or early summer. Patagonium griseum is adapted to withstand extreme temperatures and is often found in high-altitude environments.
